description: Male and female sheephead have different color patterns and body shapes. The male is larger, with black tail and head sections; wide, reddish-orange midriff; and red eyes and a fleshy forehead bump. The female is dull pink over most of its body.
notableFeatures: In 2009, fishermen made almost $334,000 in revenue from catching California sheephead. The California Department of Fish and Game established fishing regulations to protect sheephead in 2001.
